abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Ulaanbaatar
            Services Improvement Project for Mongolia is to provide
            improved water supply to the urban poor in a sustainable
            manner. This restructuring paper is states (i) a
            reallocation of International Development Association (IDA)
            funds; and (ii) an extension of the closing date until
            December 31, 2011. The borrower requested the restructuring
            of the project through a letter from the Ministry of Finance
            (MOF), dated June 8, 2011. The project was approved on April
            29, 2004 and has made steady progress towards its project
            development objectives. As of April 2011, nearly all the
            original components had completed. The remaining three
            activities, namely the household water and sewerage
            connections in Dambadarjaa ger area, installation of a
            telemetry system in central source, and installation of
            control and mechanical valves in the water network, are
            expected to be finalized by the end of June 2011. The
            project has benefited more than 300,000 residents of ger
            areas of Ulaanbaatar by improving both access to water and
            quality of water supply. More than 50 percent of water
            kiosks in ger areas are now connected to the water supply
            network and serve 300 to 500 customers per day per kiosk.
            The project also contributed to improving the operating
            performance of the Water Supply and Sewerage Authority of
            Ulaanbaatar (USUG). The project has savings of SDR 978,000
            (about US$1.5 million) from works and goods the borrower has
            requested an extension of the closing date from June 30,
            2011 to December 31, 2011 with three months of grace period.
            The extension is necessary to complete the additional activities.
